pullRequest.body:
We say a morphism of schemes is smooth (of relative dimension `n`) if for every point of the source there exist affine open neighborhoods of the point and its image such that the induced ring map is standard smooth (of relative dimension `n`). These notions are local on the source and the target and satisfy the standard stability properties.

This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing algebraic geometry" in June 2024.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [ ] depends on: #16868
- [ ] depends on: #17305 
- [ ] depends on: #17335

@chrisflav . It seems that you are planning to split this up into multiple PRs. What is the status of that? It would be great to get this work moving along!

> @chrisflav . It seems that you are planning to split this up into multiple PRs. What is the status of that? It would be great to get this work moving along!

Sorry, I was pushing on other fronts lately and did not have time to come to the review party. The first two PRs in this series are merged:
- #14271 
- #14325 
And I'll continue this series after my summer vacation.
Enjoy your vacation! I'm labelling this as awaiting-author then.

I just opened another batch of PRs on standard smooth algebras:
- #16727
- #16869
- #16853
- #16827
- #16868

This PR/issue depends on:
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#16868
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#17305
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#17335
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

```suggestion
structure Algebra.Presentation extends (P : Algebra.Generators.{w} R S) where
  /-- The type of relations.  -/
  relations : Type t
  /-- The assignment of each relation to a polynomial in the generators. -/
  relation : relations ‚Üí P.Ring
```
That syntax does not seem to work? It gives "unkown identifier `P`"
I think you should just say that `relation` spans the kernel ideal.
I don't think we need this, and we should just define `P.Ideal := RingHom.ker (eval P.val)`
I think we should have the equivalence, but I refactored it so its better now.

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicGeometry): smooth morphisms of schemes
